Eks Bos McDonald's Diberi Pesangon Rp8,6 Miliar Usai Dipecat
05 Nov 2019, 13:37 by , https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Mantan Presiden sekaligus Direktur Eksekutif McDonald's, Steve Easterbrook. (AP Photo/Richard Drew)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia -- Mantan Presiden sekaligus Direktur Eksekutif McDonald's, Steve Easterbrook (52), dilaporkan diberi pesangon sebesar US$675 ribu (Rp8,6 miliar) setelah dipecat pada akhir pekan lalu. Dia didepak dari perusahaan asalÂ Amerika Serikat itu karena menjalin hubungan asmara dengan seorang karyawan.Seperti dilansir The Guardian, Selasa (5/11), meski demikian, McDonald's tetap membolehkan Easterbrook memegang saham sebesar US$37 juta (sekitar Rp518 miliar).Kuasa hukum Easterbrook, Desiree Moore, menyatakan kliennya sangat berterima kasih atas kesempatan yang diberikan McDonald's selama ini.Selain memberi pesangon dan jaminan kesehatan selama 18 bulan, McDonald's meminta Easterbrook meneken perjanjian untuk tidak berkarir selama dua tahun di perusahaan pesaing. Dia dilarang bekerja sementara di Burger King, Five Guys, Checker's, Tim Horton's, Pizza Hut, Kentucky Fried Chicken, Subway, Chick-fil-A, Chipotle and Domino's Pizza, Starbucks, Caffe Nero dan Costa.Easterbrook lantas menulis surat yang berisi permohonan maaf atas perbuatan yang dianggap melanggar aturan. Surat itu dikirim melalui surel kepada seluruh karyawan McDonald's."Alasan kepergian saya adalah saya terlibat hubungan asmara dengan seorang karyawan, yang melanggar aturan McDonald's. Saya sadar ini sebuah kesalahan. Dan saya juga memahami keputusan dewan komisaris yang sejalan dengan nilai-nilai perusahaan ini. Ini saatnya bagi saya untuk terus maju dan saya berharap kalian menghargai privasi saya," tulis Easterbrook.Dewan komisaris McDonald's lantas menunjuk Presiden McDonald's Amerika Serikat, Chris Kempczinski, sebagai pengganti Easterbrook.Easterbrook bekerjadi McDonald's sejak 1993. Dia sempat keluar pada 2011 dan menjadi petinggi Pizza Express dan Wagamama.Dua tahun kemudian dia kembali ke McDonald's sebagai Kepala Pemasaran Merek. Pada 2015, Easterbrook didapuk menjadi direktur eksekutif, sekaligus menjabat anggota dewan komisaris di Walmart.Easterbrook diketahui sudah bercerai dengan istrinya dan dikaruniai tiga orang anak dari pernikahannya. (ayp/ayp)

Former McDonald's Boss Was Given Severance Rp8.6 Billion After Being Fired
05 Nov 2019, 13:37 by, https://www.facebook.com/CNNIndonesia


Former President and Executive Director of McDonald's, Steve Easterbrook. (AP Photo / Richard Drew)

Jakarta, CNN Indonesia - Former President and Executive Director of McDonald's, Steve Easterbrook (52), was reportedly given severance pay of US $ 675 thousand (Rp8.6 billion) after being fired last weekend. He was expelled from the United States company for having an affair with an employee. As reported by The Guardian, Tuesday (5/11), however, McDonald's still allows Easterbrook to hold shares of US $ 37 million (around Rp518 billion). , Desiree Moore, said his client was very grateful for the opportunity given by McDonald's so far. In addition to providing severance and health insurance for 18 months, McDonald's asked Easterbrook to sign an agreement not to have a career for two years at a competing company. He was banned from working temporarily at Burger King, Five Guys, Checker's, Tim Horton's, Pizza Hut, Kentucky Fried Chicken, Subway, Chick-fil-A, Chipotle and Domino's Pizza, Starbucks, Caffe Nero and Costa. EASTERBOOK then wrote a letter containing an application sorry for actions that are considered to violate the rules. The letter was sent by e-mail to all McDonald's employees. "The reason for my departure was that I was involved in an affair with an employee, who violated McDonald's rules. I realized this was a mistake. And I also understood the board's decision which was in line with the company's values. It's time for me to move forward and I hope you respect my privacy, "wrote Easterbrook. McDonald's board of commissioners then appointed the President of McDonald's United States, Chris Kempczinski, as Easterbrook's successor. EASTerbrook has been working with McDonald's since 1993. Pizza Express and Wagamama. Two years later he returned to McDonald's as Head of Brand Marketing. In 2015, Easterbrook was appointed executive director, while serving as a member of the board of commissioners at Walmart. Easterbrook is known to have divorced his wife and has three children from his marriage. (ayp / ayp)
